jobDescription: At HouseCanary, were using data and analytics to predict the future of US residential real estate. Our goal is to help people make better decisions by offering innovative and unparalleled insights. HouseCanarys platform accurately forecasts values 36 months into the future for four million residential blocks and more than 100 million properties.We're seeking a passionate data scientist to help develop best-in-class analytical models used to power HouseCanary products.What you'll do: Define, build and own statistical & machine learning models, algorithms and bodies of researchHelp product managers, stakeholders, and data analysts derive the most value out of research models, algorithms, and discoveries by communicating research output in an easily digestible fashionCollaborate with data engineers to integrate models and various research initiatives into HouseCanary productsDerive new key performance metrics for measuring model performance and stabilityEvaluate new data sources for quality and feature extractionCreate valuation logic and value various subcomponents of property characteristics, i.e., estimating the value of 300 additional square feet in market after controlling for other property characteristicsWhat you have:Undergraduate and graduate degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, engineering or another closely related fieldAt least one year of applied model building experienceExperience in data mining, natural language processing, or machine learningAdvanced knowledge of at least one programming language (R or Python is highly desired)Special consideration given for:Ph.D. in statistics, mathematics, economics, or engineeringKnowledge of residential real estate marketFantastic sense of humorHouseCanary is the authoritative source for accurate, uniform information, analyzed and visualized real-time to make better, faster decisions.HouseCanary - one platform, infinite insights.
